speaker: IAGO
text: What, are you hurt, lieutenant?

speaker: CASSIO
text: Ay, past all surgery.

speaker: IAGO
text: Marry, God forbid!

speaker: CASSIO
text: Reputation, reputation, reputation! O, I have

speaker: CASSIO
text: lost my reputation! I have lost the immortal part of

speaker: CASSIO
text: myself, and what remains is bestial. My reputation,

speaker: CASSIO
text: Iago, my reputation!

speaker: IAGO
text: As I am an honest man, I thought you had

speaker: IAGO
text: received some bodily wound. There is more sense

speaker: IAGO
text: in that than in reputation. Reputation is an idle and

speaker: IAGO
text: most false imposition, oft got without merit and lost

speaker: IAGO
text: without deserving. You have lost no reputation at

speaker: IAGO
text: all, unless you repute yourself such a loser. What,

speaker: IAGO
text: man, there are ways to recover the General again!

speaker: IAGO
text: You are but now cast in his mood—a punishment

speaker: IAGO
text: more in policy than in malice, even so as one would

speaker: IAGO
text: beat his offenseless dog to affright an imperious

speaker: IAGO
text: lion. Sue to him again and he’s yours.

speaker: CASSIO
text: I will rather sue to be despised than to deceive

speaker: CASSIO
text: so good a commander with so slight, so drunken,

speaker: CASSIO
text: and so indiscreet an officer. Drunk? And speak

speaker: CASSIO
text: parrot? And squabble? Swagger? Swear? And discourse

speaker: CASSIO
text: fustian with one’s own shadow? O thou

speaker: CASSIO
text: invisible spirit of wine, if thou hast no name to be

speaker: CASSIO
text: known by, let us call thee devil!

speaker: IAGO
text: What was he that you followed with your sword?

speaker: IAGO
text: What had he done to you?

speaker: CASSIO
text: I know not.

speaker: IAGO
text: Is ’t possible?

speaker: CASSIO
text: I remember a mass of things, but nothing

speaker: CASSIO
text: distinctly; a quarrel, but nothing wherefore. O

speaker: CASSIO
text: God, that men should put an enemy in their

speaker: CASSIO
text: mouths to steal away their brains! That we should

speaker: CASSIO
text: with joy, pleasance, revel, and applause transform

speaker: CASSIO
text: ourselves into beasts!

speaker: IAGO
text: Why, but you are now well enough. How came

speaker: IAGO
text: you thus recovered?

speaker: CASSIO
text: It hath pleased the devil drunkenness to give

speaker: CASSIO
text: place to the devil wrath. One unperfectness shows

speaker: CASSIO
text: me another, to make me frankly despise myself.

speaker: IAGO
text: Come, you are too severe a moraler. As the time,

speaker: IAGO
text: the place, and the condition of this country stands,

speaker: IAGO
text: I could heartily wish this had not so befallen. But

speaker: IAGO
text: since it is as it is, mend it for your own good.

speaker: CASSIO
text: I will ask him for my place again; he shall tell

speaker: CASSIO
text: me I am a drunkard! Had I as many mouths as

speaker: CASSIO
text: Hydra, such an answer would stop them all. To be

speaker: CASSIO
text: now a sensible man, by and by a fool, and presently

speaker: CASSIO
text: a beast! O, strange! Every inordinate cup is unblessed,

speaker: CASSIO
text: and the ingredient is a devil.

speaker: IAGO
text: Come, come, good wine is a good familiar creature,

speaker: IAGO
text: if it be well used. Exclaim no more against it.

speaker: IAGO
text: And, good lieutenant, I think you think I love you.

speaker: CASSIO
text: I have well approved it, sir.—I drunk!

speaker: IAGO
text: You or any man living may be drunk at a time,

speaker: IAGO
text: man. I’ll tell you what you shall do. Our general’s

speaker: IAGO
text: wife is now the general: I may say so in this

speaker: IAGO
text: respect, for that he hath devoted and given up

speaker: IAGO
text: himself to the contemplation, mark, and denotement

speaker: IAGO
text: of her parts and graces. Confess yourself

speaker: IAGO
text: freely to her. Importune her help to put you in your

speaker: IAGO
text: place again. She is of so free, so kind, so apt, so

speaker: IAGO
text: blessed a disposition she holds it a vice in her

speaker: IAGO
text: goodness not to do more than she is requested. This

speaker: IAGO
text: broken joint between you and her husband entreat

speaker: IAGO
text: her to splinter, and, my fortunes against any lay

speaker: IAGO
text: worth naming, this crack of your love shall grow

speaker: IAGO
text: stronger than it was before.

speaker: CASSIO
text: You advise me well.

speaker: IAGO
text: I protest, in the sincerity of love and honest

speaker: IAGO
text: kindness.

speaker: CASSIO
text: I think it freely; and betimes in the morning I

speaker: CASSIO
text: will beseech the virtuous Desdemona to undertake

speaker: CASSIO
text: for me. I am desperate of my fortunes if they check

speaker: CASSIO
text: me here.
